intro: Eriogonum palmeri, commonly known as Palmer's buckwheat, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family and is characterized by its branched stems and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats such as deserts and sagebrush steppe. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered in fine hairs, and it produces small, triangular seeds. Eriogonum palmeri is adapted to arid environments and plays a role in supporting local pollinators and wildlife.
